title: I'm confused as to why no S.

embed.description: Grab seriously instant screenshots, screen GIFs, and webpage captures. Get the free app for Windows or Mac to streamline your visual sharing and bookmarking today.

body: I went 15/0, over 100 CS, warded 5 times(not much tbh), and got the last kill on 3 towers and rift herald. I'm just kinda flabbergasted as to how this is possible?

replies.body: Don't ever forget... "Damage Dealt to Champions"

I think it also gauges your performance in comparison to other players of the same champion/role. Something like ADC is almost certainly heavily weighted towards CS, where as something like support probably doesn't get penalized for having almost no CS in a 20 minute game. Furthermore, champions like Zilean with little kill potential are probably less weighted on kills than champs like Katarina. 

Not sure what exact stats riot uses but I'm like 90% sure this is how it works.
Because it was 5.7 cs a minute. Standard is around 7 minimum

Your CS was at jungler levels at 20 minutes. I understand that rofl-stomp games can make farming harder (it's more important to take a free tower than go farm a big wave), but that's just how it breaks down.

Also, vision score.. "I dropped 5 wards", in a 20 minute game, is 1 ward every 4 minutes. You could drop basically triple that amount with minimal effort. If you REALLY want to rack up vision score, you've gotta go ward hunting.

VS and CS (vision score and creep score) are the two things you need high to get an S; that and a low number of deaths. S ranks really don't give a shit about your champion kills, because this isn't a team death match game.
I see. thank you for the quick responses and clearing it up. :D

First, it's really hard to get an S grade on a 20 minute game.

Second: "over 100 CS" and "5 wards" are like bare minimum expectations. Those aren't impressive stats, I'm sorry to tell you (and one of reasons 20 minute games are hard to get S's on because you can't farm or place as many wards)
